sen.j: 不空院（ふくういん）は奈良県奈良市高畑にある真言律宗の仏教寺院。
sen.e: Fuku-in Temple, located at Takahata, Nara City in Nara Prefecture, is the temple of Shuingon Ritsu sect of Buddhism.
Fuku-in Temple, located at Takahata, Nara City in Nara Prefecture, is the temple of Shuingon Ritsu sect of Buddhism.
Fuku-in Temple, located at Takahata, Nara City in Nara Prefecture, is the temple of Shingon Ritsu sect of Buddhism.

sen.j: 山号は春日山（しゅんにちさん）。
sen.e: Its honorific mountain prefix is Shunnichisan.
Its honorific mountain prefix is Shunnichisan.
Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Shunnichisan.
Another name is Fukui no Daishi.
Another name is Fukui no Daishi.
Another name is Fukui no Daishi.
Its principal image is the statue of Fukukensaku Kannon(The Deity of Mercy).
Its principal image is the statue of Fukukensaku Kannon(The Deity of Mercy).
Its principal image is the statue of Fukukensaku Kannon (The Deity of Mercy).
sen.cmt: スペース挿入しました。

sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 鑑真の住坊跡に建立された寺院で、鎌倉時代には叡尊、円晴、覚盛、有厳が当院で戒律を講じたという由緒ある古刹。
sen.e: The temple was founded at the site Ganjin previously used as a lodge and is a very historic temple for having commandment lecture from such famous priests as Enson,Ensei,Kakujo and Ukon in the Kamakura period.

The temple was founded at the site previously used by Ganjin as a lodge and is a very historic temple for having commandment lectures from such famous priests as Enson, Ensei, Kakujo and Ukon during the Kamakura period.

The temple was founded at the site previously used by Ganjin as a lodge and is a very historic temple for having commandment lectures from such famous priests as Enson, Ensei, Kakujo and Ukon during the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました。

sen.j: 室町時代は大乗院の祈願所に定められていた。
sen.e: The temple was designated as the prayer hall of Daijo-in Temple in the Muromachi Period.
The temple was designated as the prayer hall of Daijo-in Temple in the Muromachi Period.
The temple was designated as the prayer hall of Daijo-in Temple in the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 近世は本堂に弁才天が安置されていること、また院号が転じて福院とも呼ばれてことで、「かけこみ寺」としてならまちの芸妓達の信仰を集めていた。
sen.e: The temple attracted many geiko (professional female entertainer) in Naramachi as a 'kakekomi-dera' (refuge temple) since Benzaiten (the Goddess of Music and Art) was enshrined in the main hall, and the temple has another name of Fuku(fortune) -in Temple.

The temple has attracted many geiko (professional female entertainers) in Naramachi as a 'kakekomi-dera' (refuge temple) since Benzaiten (the Goddess of Music and Art) was enshrined in the main hall, and the temple has another name Fuku (fortune)-in Temple.

sen.j: 八角円堂礎石 - 813年に空海が興福寺の南円堂を建立する際、その雛型とした八角円堂（1854年の安政の大地震で倒壊）の礎石
sen.e: The foundation stone of Hakkakuendo (destroyed by the Ansei Great Earthquake in 1854) which was a model of the Nanendo in Kofuku-ji Temple when Kukai built it in 813.

sen.j: 木造不空羂索観音 - 坐像、漆箔玉眼、103,9cm、鎌倉時代
sen.e: The wooden seated Statue of Fukukensaku Kannon (Deity of Mercy) has gyokugan (jade Buddhist eyes) with lacquered leaf and it is 103.9 cm in height and made in the Kamakura Period.
